page.title: 09BURTON JOYCE-EDUCATION
page.content: Mrs.Marson,retired infant teacher was born and has lived all her life in the village.She began teaching in the village hall in 1955.She had 97 pupils and another teacher to help.She had little equipment and sometimes the pupils had to leave so that other groups could use the hall. She remembers the village by-pass being built in the 1930's and travelling to Nottingham by train for 4d and bus for 10d return.There were no houses at all up to and past the new school,where there used to be an orchard. Mrs.Marson taught a mother and a father of two children in Mrs.Kirby's class and now her granddaughter is in our infant department.She worked for five head teachers during her 24 years at Burton Joyce school.
